contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox gymnast |name= Joaquín Blume |image= Jardins de Joan Brossa - Barcelona 12.JPG |fullname= |altname= |nickname= |country={{ESP}} |formercountry= |birth_date= {{Birth date|1933|06|21}} |birth_place= |hometown= |residence= |death_date={{Death date and age|1959|04|29|1933|06|21}} |death_place= |height= |discipline=MAG |level= |natlteam= |club= |gym= |headcoach= |formercoach= |choreographer= |music= |eponymousskills= |retired= |medaltemplates= <!-- see [[Template:MedalRelatedTemplates]] --> }} '''Joaquín Blume''', in Catalan language '''Joaquim Blume''', (June 21, 1933 – April 29, 1959) was a [[Spain|Spanish]] [[Gymnastics|gymnast]]. The son of a German gymnastics instructor established in Barcelona,<ref name="elmundo">[http://www.elmundo.es/elmundodeporte/2009/04/29/masdeporte/1240993715.html 50 años sin Joaquim Blume]</ref> he belonged to the gymnastics section of [[FC Barcelona]].<ref name="fcb_arxiu">[http://arxiu.fcbarcelona.cat/web/castellano/noticies/club/temporada08-09/04/n090429104729.html 50 años de la muerte de Joaquín Blume]</ref> He became Spanish gymnastics champion at 15<ref name="elmundo" /> and he competed in the [[1952 Summer Olympics]] of [[Helsinki]] with only 19 years.<ref name="fcb_arxiu" /> He went to win eight medals in the [[1955 Mediterranean Games]]<ref name="elmundo" /> and in 1957 he won the [[European Men's Artistic Gymnastics Championships|European Championship]], defeating favourite [[Yuri Titov]].<ref name="fcb_arxiu" /> He was a favourite for the [[1956 Summer Olympics]] of [[Melbourne]], until [[Spain]] boycotted the games in protest against the presence of the [[USSR]], after their brutal suppression of the [[1956 Hungarian Revolution|Hungarian Revolution]]. He was also a favourite in the [[1960 Summer Olympics]], but he died in a plane crash at the [[Valdemeca]] mountains, in [[Cuenca (province)|Cuenca]], on April 29, 1959. The plane was headed for [[Canarias]], where the Spanish gymnastics team were to do a gymnastics exhibition. His wife, also a gymnast and pregnant with their second child, was also a passenger. There were no survivors.<ref name="fcb_arxiu" /> He was survived by a daughter <ref>[http://hemeroteca.lavanguardia.com/preview/1984/04/27/pagina-44/32837586/pdf.html La Vanguardia - Edición del viernes, 27 abril 1984, página 44 ]</ref> In his honour, the Catalonian Gymnastics Federation started in 1969 the Memorial Joaquim Blume tournament, first only of male gymnastics with female competition introduced in 1972.<ref name="elmundo" /> A sculpture in his honour is displayed at the Gardens of Joan Brossa, in Barcelona. ==References== <references /> {{Footer European Artistic Gymnastics All-Around Champions (Men)}} . {{Authority control|VIAF=56172605}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Blume, Joaquin | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Spanish gymnast | DATE OF BIRTH = June 21, 1933 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = April 29, 1959 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Blume, Joaquin}} [[Category:1933 births]] [[Category:1959 deaths]] [[Category:Spanish artistic gymnasts]] [[Category:Victims of aviation accidents or incidents in Spain]] [[Category:Spanish people of German descent]] [[Category:Catalan gymnasts]] [[Category:Gymnasts at the 1952 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic gymnasts of Spain]] [[Category:Burials at Montjuïc Cemetery]] {{Spain-sport-bio-stub}} {{Artistic-gymnastics-bio-stub}}
